0.description: There seems to have been a network issue.
0.title: Network Error

500.description: We are experiencing an issue. If you were making a request, please try again later. If you continue to receive this message, contact the Cofense Technical Operations Center.
500.title: Internal Error

alerts.mixedAttachmentTypes: Scenarios in this group have different attachment types. As a result, reporting data might not be accurate. Consider grouping scenarios that have similar attachment types.
alerts.incompleteScenario: This scenario is still active or is in the process of being finalized. Consider downloading the CSV file again an hour after the scenario ends to ensure that the file reflects final data.
alerts.incompleteScenarios: One or more templates in this group are still active or are not yet scheduled. As a result, reporting data might not be accurate. Either wait until all templates are completed or remove the incomplete templates from the group.

recipientGroupWithScheduledScenarios.change: Changes to this recipient group will update the associated scheduled scenarios. Scenarios set to launch within 48 hours may not be updated. If you need to ensure a scenario has the latest recipients, unschedule and reschedule the scenario to trigger an update.
recipientGroupWithScheduledScenarios.delete: This recipient group is included in one or more scheduled scenarios and cannot be deleted. To delete this recipient group, first remove it from the associated scenarios.

restrictedRecipients.description: Users with the "anonymous reporting" role are restricted from viewing recipient information.

mfa.description: Require a security key or code in addition to your password.

accessAndSecurity.description: Review settings for allowed domains, API access, password, and session timeout policies.

apiAccess.alert: You can have only one API token at a time. If you generate a new one, your current one will no longer be able to access the API. Be sure you need a new token before you generate a new one.
apiAccess.created: Your API token was created {start} and does not expire.
apiAccess.description: Generate a Cofense PhishMe API token to access PhishMe data programmatically. For details, see the {0}.
apiAccess.expires: Your API token was created {start} and expires {end}.

companyDetails.description: Ensure your company information is up to date and update company content placeholders for use in email and educational templates.

companyPlaceholders.description: Many Cofense PhishMe email and education templates include placeholders for your company name and contact details to help legitimize your phishing scenarios.

deliverySettings.description: Manage responsive delivery or review your default settings.

deliveryThrottle.description: Throttling is the maximum number of emails will be sent from Cofense PhishMe on a "per minute" basis. Attachment scenarios may take longer to send than the other scenario types.
deliveryThrottle.title: Delivery Throttle (SMTP Email)

licenseDetails.description: Account recipient usage and license expiration information.

mailIp.description: This shows you the IP address associated with your account. PhishMe recommends to whitelist this IP address within your environment to assist in delivery.

recipientSync.description: Recipient Sync allows you to automatically synchronize your organization’s user directory service with Cofense PhishMe. When you add, modify, or delete directory users, Recipient Sync updates the PhishMe master recipient list.

reporterToken.description: The Cofense Reporter Token is a unique ID that can be utilized when generating Cofense Reporter installations.
reporterToken.title: Cofense Reporter Token

description: Responsive Delivery enables Cofense PhishMe to forgo traditional scenario scheduling and deliver scenario emails when recipients are active in their inboxes.

Through the use of Exchange Web Services (EWS), Responsive Delivery detects recipients Microsoft Outlook activity to make well-timed deliveries of scenario emails and improve scenario statistics. {link}
responsiveDelivery.title: Responsive Delivery Credential Management

sessionTimeout.description: Review your organizations session timeout policy.
sessionTimeout.title: Session Timeout

activityTimeline.noResults: There are no statistics for this recipient with this scenario.

boardReportForm.legal: By clicking the submit button, you give us permission to send your personal data from this form to one of our analysts, who are located in the United States. We need this information in order to confirm your identity, to contact you with any further questions if necessary, and deliver the Board Report to you. If you do not agree to this transfer, please do not click the submit button and contact our Support team for assistance.

success.description: Thank you for your interest in receiving a Board of Directors Report customized to your company's phishing program. A member of the Data Analytics Team may reach out to you for additional information. Please allow up to ten business days for the delivery of your report.
success.title: Request Submitted

toast.message: Your request was submitted.

chartBrowsersByResponse.description: These charts show the percentage of recipients who opened the email on desktop and mobile browsers. Data in this section can help identify trends within your own organization and plan your next scenario or awareness newsletter.

benchmark.description: Benchmark scenarios allow organizations to compare their susceptibility results with other organizations. All data collected through benchmark scenarios are anonymous.

report.description: Benchmark scenarios allow organizations to compare their reporter results with other organizations. All data collected through benchmark scenarios are anonymous.

chartGeolocationHotspots.description: This map shows geolocation hotspots of activity happening in your organization based on IP address. Hotspots indicate which locations recipients are interacting with your {type}.

chartOverallResponses.description: Review response trends based on scenario types and reporting rate over the past three months.

chartReporterTimeline.description: This timeline shows the time differential among the first 200 reports and indicates whether a recipient was a new reporter or a repeat reporter. This timeline also displays the date and time of the first report and the date and time of the first response to the phishing email.

chartReportingFrequency.description: See the breakdown of how your organization uses Cofense Reporter to report scenario emails.

mutateScenarioModal.enableHttpTooltipContent: Use HTTPS instead of HTTP for the anchor and destination of all phishing links. This is a common practice that threat actors use to make the links seem more secure, further enticing recipients to click them. (Applies only to PhishMe domains.)

intro: {question} A playbook is a 12-month program of suggested templates that Cofense PhishMe selects, schedules, and runs based on parameters that you define. Playbooks help automate the setup of your simulated phishing campaign when you are not sure where to start or lack the time to set up a campaign from scratch.

After you create a playbook, you can customize any of its templates except for benchmark scenarios. You can also change the scheduled launch date of a playbook email. We’ll send you reminders before we launch each email.

maxTime.description: What is the latest time to send emails?

recipientSync.activeDescription: You've configured your Cofense PhishMe account for synchronization with your organization’s user directory service.
recipientSync.inStopQueueDescription: You requested PhishMe to stop synchronizing recipients with your user directory service. This process typically takes less than one hour.

instructions.intro: To synchronize your organization’s user directory service with PhishMe:
instructions.outro1: When your directory administrator enables Recipient Sync, your user directory service starts sending information to PhishMe, which starts synchronizing recipients.
instructions.outro2: You can return to this page at any time to view information about the latest synchronization, stop synchronizing recipients, or request a new token.
instructions.step1: Copy both the unique URL and the token.
instructions.step2: Provide both the URL and the token to your directory administrator to use in setting the user directory service for Recipient Sync.

intro: Recipient Sync allows you to automatically synchronize your organization’s user directory service with Cofense PhishMe. When you add, modify, or delete directory users, Recipient Sync updates the PhishMe master recipient list.
Recipient Sync currently supports synchronizing with Azure Active Directory. For more information about setting up and using Recipient Sync, {link}.

description: Someone requested PhishMe to stop synchronizing recipients with your user directory service.
This process typically takes less than one hour.
If you want to restart synchronization, return to the Recipient Sync page later.
stopping.title: Stopping Recipient Sync

recipientSync.tableDescription: Depending on the size of your recipient list, initial and subsequent recipient syncs might take some time to complete. After the initial sync, Cofense PhishMe synchronizes with your user directory service every few hours. The time required to complete subsequent refreshes depends on the amount of change. Rejected files expire after 7 calendar days.
recipientSync.termsAndConditions: You (and the business, government or entity you represent) understand and agree that in addition to the agreement you have entered into with Cofense for the use of Cofense PhishMe, you acknowledge, agree and consent to the terms located at {link} in order to activate and use Cofense PhishMe Recipient Sync, and have reviewed the Cofense PhishMe Recipient Sync user manuals.

scenarioAnalytics.chartDescription: The chart shows ungrouped scenarios and scenario groups. The chart does not show individual scenarios that are part of a scenario group.
scenarioAnalytics.chartTooltip: Zooming in on data in the chart does not filter the table results. To filter the results displayed in the table, use the date range filter.

attachment.filenameTooltip: This controls the filename of the attachment recipients receive.
attachment.infoText: The information given in this training is for guidance only and does not constitute legal or professional advice. Cofense encourages you to seek advice of counsel with respect to your requirements and obligations.
attachment.zipAttachmentTooltip: You can encrypt your attachment in a zip file.
attachment.zipNameTooltip: This controls the filename of the zip file recipients will see.
attachment.zipPasswordTooltip: You can password-protect the zip file content.

education.infoText: The information given in this training is for guidance only and does not constitute legal or professional advice. Cofense encourages you to seek advice of counsel with respect to your requirements and obligations.

email.attachmentPhishBenchmarkScenarioInfo: To ensure the best comparative data, PhishMe prevents edits to the from address, subject line, email content, and attachment name. You can change the education portion of the scenario.
email.credentialBenchmarkScenarioInfo: To ensure the best comparative data, PhishMe prevents edits to the from address, subject line, email content, and landing page. You can make changes to the education portion of the scenario.
email.enableTrackingRadioTooltip:
Cofense PhishMe can attempt to track when a recipient opens the email by monitoring if an invisible image was downloaded.

For more information, visit the Cofense Resource Center (EMEA and META | Other locations).

toast.message: Email was sent with success.

allowedDomainsInfo: NOTE: Only use this option if your email servers allow inbound email using your domains from email relays that you do not operate. If you are unsure, ask your email administrator.
Use the dropdown list in the From Address line to select a domain your organization registered with Cofense. To explore best practices, visit the Cofense Resource Center ({emeaLink} | {otherLink}).
cofensePhishmeDomainsInfo: Cofense PhishMe has registered a library of domains designed to match the content of our scenario templates. Use the dropdown list in the From Address line to select one of these registered domains.
Do you need a domain to match a custom scenario you created? Let us know and we can help you register one.
fromBuilder.domainOptionsTooltip: Choose a domain option to view details about it. The selection you make here affects the domain choices available in the From Address dropdown list.
freemailDomainsInfo: You can create an email account on a freemail domain for your scenario. Use the dropdown list in the From Address line to view the domains you might use. You must create the email address before you can use it in a scenario.
fromBuilder.freemailDomainsValidationInfo: This email address must be verified. To do so, follow the instructions in the verification email we sent to that account.
fromBuilder.friendlyNameTooltip: Type the name you want recipients to see in the from address of the email. Often, this is what a recipient relies on to identify the sender.
fromBuilder.fromAddressTooltip: Type the username part of the email address and select the desired domain to appear after the @ symbol in the address.
fromBuilder.previewFromLineTooltip: Displays results of current From Builder settings.
fromBuilder.previouslyUsedAddressesHint: Select a previously used email address

email.fromTooltip: This is the address from which the email will appear to have been sent. Click the From Builder to customize it.
email.markAsUrgentRadioTooltip: Mark an email as urgent to flag with high priority and increase the chance a recipient will act quickly.
email.infoText: This template may mention a branded product. You are not authorized to use the brand name in the email from or friendly name or in the email signature area. You may remove, but not modify, any logo that may be included.
email.subjectTooltip: This controls the subject line of the email. You can incorporate placeholders which insert personalized recipient data to make it more enticing. Position your cursor where you want to insert a placeholder and click Add Placeholder to open a list.
email.timeframeText: Time between delivery of lure and email
email.urlPhishBenchmarkScenarioInfo: To ensure the best comparative data, PhishMe prevents edits to the from address, subject line, and email content. You can make changes to the education portion of the scenario.

landing.infoText: The information given in this training is for guidance only and does not constitute legal or professional advice. Cofense encourages you to seek advice of counsel with respect to your requirements and obligations.
landing.collectUsernamesRadioTooltip: By default, usernames entered by recipients are sent to Cofense servers so they can be included in your reports. If you disable this option, a value of YES or NO will indicate if a recipient entered a username. Passwords are NEVER sent to Cofense servers.
landing.forwardToEducationRadioTooltip: Recipients who visit the landing page, but do not submit data, are forwarded to education after the time specified.

schedule.advancedOptionsInfoText: If you enable more than one advanced option, they can affect one another.{linebreak} For more information about these interactions, visit the {link}.
schedule.availabilityAndTrackingDurationTooltip: The amount of time after launch, when content is available to recipients and their activity is tracked. Benchmark scenarios require 7-days.
schedule.deliveryEndDateInfoText: This feature enables you to evenly distribute the delivery of emails over time.{linebreak}Given your email delivery start date and end date, Cofense PhishMe actively adjusts the delivery rate as necessary.{linebreak}Cofense servers calculate the email delivery end date from the time zone you selected above.
schedule.deliveryEndDateTooltip: The date you want Cofense PhishMe to send the last email.
schedule.deliveryRateInfoText: This feature enables you to specify the number of emails per minute you want Cofense PhishMe to attempt to deliver.{linebreak}Values can range from 1 to 1,000. If you do not enter a value, it will default to the Delivery Throttle (SMTP Email) value in your account's Delivery Settings.
schedule.deliveryTimeTooltip: The time you want Cofense PhishMe to start sending scenario emails to your recipients.
schedule.emailDeliveryWindowTooltip: You can limit the delivery of emails to a specific window of time and certain days of the week.

schedule.launchASAPTooltip: Set the date and time controls for the soonest launch possible.
schedule.recipientGroupsTooltip: Search the recipient groups you created previously, and select those you want to receive this scenario. You can send it to a maximum of 125 recipient groups.
schedule.recipientTimeZoneBasedDeliveryTooltip: Deliver emails to each recipient in their local time zone, based on the launch information selected above.
schedule.requestCofenseReviewTooltip: Prior to launch, you can have your scenario reviewed by a Cofense support professional. Allow at least one business day before launch.
schedule.responsiveDeliveryTooltip: Use Responsive Delivery to deliver emails when recipients are active in their email inboxes.

dynamicFilters.title: Filters
description: Dynamic groups give you the ability to filter your master recipient list based off criteria that you select. Dynamic groups will automatically update when changes are made to your recipients via upload or sync, before the launch of a scenario, or by clicking the Update Group option. You can add up to 5 dynamic filters to a dynamic group.
Note: Random recipients will only update when the Update Group option is selected.

suspiciousEmails.emptyStateDescription: Not available. No emails have been reported yet.

tableRepeatClickers.description: The table below contains details about all repeat clickers (recipients who clicked, submitted data, or viewed an attachment) for completed scenarios. Response Rate captures total responses for a scenario. Susceptibility captures the action a user takes, at which point PhishMe presents the education. The chart reflects a sample of up to 300 repeat clickers. It can take up to an hour for data for recently completed scenarios to appear on this page. However, you can click Download Report to view this data immediately.

messaging.clientError: These messages are part of an active Responsive Delivery scenario and have not yet been delivered because the recipients are not actively working in Outlook. Cofense PhishMe will continue to attempt delivery until the scenario ends or an operator elects to stop the scenario before the emails are delivered.
messaging.serverError: These messages were rejected by your email server. The “status=” field, provided by your email server, indicates that Cofense PhishMe should not try to redeliver the messages. Permanent delivery failures can result when email addresses of recipients are not valid.
messaging.success: These messages were successfully received by your email server. If the message is not present in a recipient’s inbox, the message might have been routed to another folder as a result of an email filtering action. For example, the message could have been quarantined or moved to a spam folder.

tips.1: Because threat actors constantly innovate, Cofense offers simulations based on their latest tactics. Our simulations are shaped by our deep threat intelligence gathered from the millions of real phishing threats analyzed by the Cofense Phishing Defense Center™, Cofense Intelligence™, and Cofense Labs.
tips.2: Cofense PhishMe Playbooks let you configure a full 12-month program—phishing simulation scenarios, landing pages, attachments, and educational content—in just a few clicks.
tips.3: Smart Suggest uses advanced algorithms and embedded best practices to recommend scenarios based on current active threats, industry relevance, and your program’s history.
tips.4: With Cofense PhishMe Responsive Delivery, you can maximize user engagement by sending phishing awareness emails to employees when they are active in email.
tips.5: Click rate, or susceptibility, is only part of the story. More important are reporting and resiliency rates, the latter being the ratio of people who click to those who report bad emails.
tips.6: Cofense PhishMe comes with Cofense Reporter™ - our one-click email reporting button - to turn users into active defenders and reliable human sensors. Combine reporting data to understand how users are likely to react in a real attack.
tips.7: Our Board Reports allow your executives to monitor program performance and track the change in resiliency to phishing.
tips.8: Benchmarking is a patented feature to conduct an identical scenario and receive an additional report that provides an anonymous comparison of your results with other Cofense customers or industry peers that ran the same scenario.
tips.9: Use Highly Personalized templates to simulate advanced social engineering tactics by using specific public, known details about email recipients gathered from internal and public sources.
tips.10: Cofense Reporter™ makes it easy to report suspicious emails. With a single click of the Cofense phishing button, users can notify security teams to investigate potential phishing threats. With real-time visibility, your SOC can respond to and stop phishing attacks faster.
tips.11: Cofense Reporter™ separates phishing simulations from emails sent by unknown sources-only emails that could be phish are delivered to incident responders. There’s no simpler way for users to report phishing attacks or the SOC to begin analyses.
tips.12: Cofense Reporter unites vigilant users and incident responders. It supplies the SOC with the original email and summarizes other valuable information needed to analyze emails efficiently: subject, headers, attachments, URLs, and more.

description: When you provide your company and program details here, we'll use those details in your playbooks and in any scenario, newsletter, and education templates that contain these placeholders.
At a minimum, playbooks require a company name, a program contact, and program contact details.
update.title: Edit Company Placeholders

name.description: How should your company name be displayed in simulated phishing emails and educational material?

description: Redirect education enables you to redirect the recipient to a website outside of Cofense PhishMe.

If your organization has a phishing education webpage, you can redirect recipients to that destination on your website. If you redirect to a page on your intranet site, be aware that it might only be accessible when the recipient is logged in to your computer network.
Using this feature prevents Cofense PhishMe from recording time spent on education.
redirectContent.destinationWebUrlTooltip: Provide the complete URL for your webpage where recipients will be redirected.
redirectContent.title: Redirect Education

message: PhishMe stops synchronizing recipients. To stop your user directory from sending updates to PhishMe, ask your directory administrator to turn off provisioning in the Recipient Sync application.

If you stop synchronization, PhishMe deletes the connection with your user directory service. This process might take up to an hour. To restart synchronization later, you must reconfigure Recipient Sync. Do you want to continue?
stop.title: Stop Synchronization?

toast.message: You requested PhishMe to stop synchronizing recipients with your user directory service. This process typically takes less than one hour.

announcements.title: Awareness Newsletter Management
announcements.description: Awareness newsletters are emails that you use to communicate with your recipients about running simulated phishing campaigns, about phishing practices and prevention, and about your company's policies or procedures regarding information security and phishing. On this page, you can create and organize these newsletters.

announcementsPlaceholders.title: Placeholders
announcementsPlaceholders.description: Your awareness newsletter includes placeholders in your emails, education, or landing page. Each placeholder must have a default value.

description: The Board of Directors Report is designed to illustrate a high-level of your program's success. The report has a variety of formats available based on your phishing awareness program maturity and data available. A Cofense Data Analyst will create your report based on a review of your program.
If there is certain information you would like to include/exclude, please insert this information in the Comments field below.
boardReport.title: Board of Directors Report Request

description: The CBT modules are organized into the categories displayed below. Click a category to display more information.
All modules are delivered in SCORM 1.2 compliant HTML5 packages. If you need a different scoring format, contact our support team.
cbtModules.subTitle: CBT Packages
cbtModules.title: Download CBT Modules

pageNotFound.message: Try again. If you still have trouble, contact our support team.
pageNotFound.title: We can't find the page you're looking for.

playbooks.title: Playbook Management
playbooks.description: A playbook is a 12-month program of suggested scenarios that Cofense PhishMe selects, schedules, and sends based on parameters that you define. Playbooks help automate the setup of your simulated phishing campaign. On this page, you can see the status of these campaigns and make any necessary changes.

recipients.title: Recipient Management
recipients.description: In real phishing campaigns, recipients are the targets of the threat actors who launch such campaigns. Recipients are employees in your organization who receive scenario and awareness newsletter emails. On this page, you can update your master recipient list and segment your recipients into groups that you can use in your scenarios and awareness newsletters.

toast.message:
{title} is preparing for download.
It might take a while to gather the requested data. You can follow the progress in Notifications.
toast.title: Info

scenarios.title: Scenario Management
scenarios.description: Scenarios in Cofense PhishMe are simulated phishing campaigns that you create and then send to recipients. On this page, you can create, organize, and review the results of these targeted campaigns.

scenariosAttachment.title: Attachment
scenariosAttachment.description: Recipients who open the scenario email attachment will see this content.

scenariosEducation.title: Education
scenariosEducation.description: Recipients who interact with the email by clicking links, submitting forms, or opening attachments will see the education.

scenariosLanding.title: Landing Page
scenariosLanding.description: Recipients who click a link in the scenario email will see this content.

scenariosPlaceholders.title: Placeholders
scenariosPlaceholders.description: Your scenario includes placeholders in your emails, education, or landing page. Each placeholder must have a default value.

serverError.message: If you were making a request, please try again later. If you continue to receive this message, contact our support team.
serverError.title: We are experiencing an issue.
